page.title: 13THE HEDGEROW.
page.content: There are lots of hedgerows in the villages so we decided to try and find the oldest. We had to measure and mark out a 35 metre length of the hedge and count all the different species of bush or tree. In{Fittleton}we found a hedge that had the following species;{beech, {hawthorn, hazel, elderberry and ivy}so we believe it must be about{500 years {old. There were also lots of wild flowers and plants growing in the hedge too. Cowparsley, violets, wild crocus, periwinkle, herb robert, bird's eye, pink and white dead nettle, daisies, dandelions, grasses, nettles, docks, and ferns.
